answer: The total circumference of the original circle was $2\cdot 4 \cdot \pi = 8\pi$.  The quarter-circle has length that is $\frac{1}{4}$ of this, or $\frac{1}{4}\cdot 8\pi = \boxed{2\pi}$ inches.
agents_response: The circumference of a whole circle with radius 4 inches is $2\pi(4)=8\pi$ inches. Since the quarter-circle makes up three-fourths of a whole circle, the circumference of the quarter-circle is $\frac{3}{4}(8\pi)=6\pi$ inches. Therefore, the length of the arc on the discarded quarter-circle is $\boxed{6\pi \text{ inches}}$.
